content:
To collect correct labels of the implant system predicted by the app, we can modify the `Case` model in the `case_management` module to include a new field `predicted_label` which will store the label predicted by the app. We can then update the case with the correct label by allowing users to edit the `predicted_label` field. Here is an updated version of the `Case` model:
```python
from google.cloud import ndb

class Case(ndb.Model):
    # fields for storing the case information
    case_id = ndb.StringProperty(required=True)
    case_name = ndb.StringProperty()
    patient_name = ndb.StringProperty()
    patient_age = ndb.IntegerProperty()
    patient_sex = ndb.StringProperty(choices=['M', 'F'])
    doctor_name = ndb.StringProperty()
    created_on = ndb.DateTimeProperty(auto_now_add=True)
    last_updated = ndb.DateTimeProperty(auto_now=True)
    
    # fields for storing the image information
    images = ndb.JsonProperty()

    # fields for storing the prediction information
    predicted_label = ndb.StringProperty()
    prediction_confidence = ndb.FloatProperty()

    # fields for sharing the case with other users
    shared_with = ndb.JsonProperty()

    # fields for storing user comments
    comments = ndb.JsonProperty()
```
With this modification, we can collect the correct labels predicted by the app for future analysis and improvements.
